description.en: Observation that assesses the biological Quality of Water based on the overall condition of indicator species.

usage.en: These species, also called BioIndicators, are living organisms such as plants, planktons, animals, microbesÂ… More specifically, biochemical, physiological, behavioural or population changes are monitored.

description.en: Result of the BioIndicatorObservation.
Type of the observedProperty.
Observation that assesses the biological Quality of Water on a certain scale based on what organisms are present in the Water and in what quantities.

usage.en: In practice this comes down to counting specimens of certain species of macro-invertebrates like worms, snails, flies, clams etc present in the Water, weighted by the extent to which they tolerate Water pollution and combined into a single WaterqQuality score.

description.en: Result of the BioticIndexObservation.
Type of the observedProperty.
Observation to assess  the chemical Quality of Water by estimating the concentration of a harmful or unsuitable substance.

usage.en: Actually the Measurement of the amount of the substance in the Water, usually over some averaging period. Result is how much of the substance is found eg in milligrams-per-liter.

description.en: Result of the ChemicalAgentConcentrationObservation.
Type of substance.
Real-world Object related to Water.

usage.en: It is the featureOfInterest, the Object of which some property is observed to assess WaterQuality. This can be for example a waterbody like the Canal Brussels-Charleroi. The Waterfeature can be typed via the "type" attribute (value would be "waterbody-canal" for example), but substitution by a typed instance (eg an instance of type "Canal", subclass of a class "Waterbody") is also allowed. In either case, the observedProperty must be a phenomenon related to the WaterFeature type. If the WaterFeature is not observed directly, but rather indirectly by sampling it, the WaterFeature is the sampledObject and the sample assumes the role of featureOfInterest.

description.en: Type of WaterFeature.
A Collection of one or more WaterQualityObservations,whose members share a common value for one or more properties.
A reference to the Object that is observed bij the Observations in the Collection.
The moment when the result of the Observation in the Collection was applicable.
A description of the weather conditions during the Observations in the Collection.
Reference to an Observation that belongs to the Collection.
Observation to assess physical Quality of Water by measuring certain physical quantities.

usage.en: These quantities are parameters like temperature, salinity, turbidity, suspended/disolved solids etc.

description.en: Tyoe of the obserdedProperty.
Result of the WaterQualityParameterObservation.
A measured amount of a particular quantity, expressed in a paricular unit of measure.
The amount.
Characteristic of a feature type
Abstract class of all possible tests to assess the quality of a dataset.

usage.en: this means a test to assess Completeness, LogicalConsistency, PositionalAccuracy, thematicAccuracy or TemporalAccuracy.

description.en: Metadata is data that contains information about data.
The determination of the value of a particular characteristic of an Object at a given time or between two times.
Object that is observed.

usage.en: Can be the Feature itself or a proxy, viz a SamplingFeature. REMARK: Sometimes the actual FeatureOfInterest is only determined after observing the proxy.

description.en: Link to the metadata of the observation.

The parameter describes an arbitrary event-specific parameter. This might be an environmental parameter, an instrument setting or input, or an event-specific sampling parameter that is not tightly bound to either the feature of interest or to the observation procedure.

Phenomenon time describes the time that the result applies to the property of the feature of interest. This is often the time of interaction by a sampling procedure or observation procedure with a real-world feature.
Estimate of the value of a property determined through a known observation procedure

The resultQuality describes the quality of the result. This instance-specific description complements the description of the observation procedure, which provides information concerning the quality of all observations using this procedure. Quality of a result may be assessed following the procedures in ISO 19114:2003.

The resultTime describes the time when the result became available, typically when the procedure associated wit hthe observation was completed. For some observations this is identical to the phenomenonTime. Howevere there are important cases where they differ.
Observations of which the results are related in one way or another
The simple value of anÂ ObservationÂ orÂ Actuation.

Link to the ultimate feature of interest of an observation or act of sampling. This is useful when the proximate feature of interest is a sample of the ultimate feature of interest, directly or transitively.
Relation between anÂ ObservationÂ and theÂ SensorÂ which made theÂ Observations.
Relation linking anÂ ObservationÂ to the property that was observed. TheÂ ObservablePropertyÂ should be a property of theÂ FeatureOfInterestÂ (linked byÂ hasFeatureOfInterest) of thisÂ Observation.
A relation to link to a re-usableÂ ProcedureÂ used in making anÂ Observation, anÂ Actuation, or aÂ Sample, typically through aÂ Sensor,Â ActuatorÂ orÂ Sampler.
The observation result in an estimate of the value of a property determined through a known observation procedure.
Feature, such as a station, transect, section or specimen, which is involved in making observations concerning a domain feature
References to the feature that one wants to sample.
Reference to other SamplingFeatures with which the SamplingFeature is associated.
An established or official way of doing something.
A series of actions or steps leading to some result.
An Observation of weather conditions at a certain place or time.
Features are abstractions of real-world phenomena.
Observation of some quantifiable characteristic of an Object.

usage.en: Eg the mass of a Rock. Result is of type Measure. For a more detailed description of this class see ISO 19156.

description.en: A collection of one or more observations,whose members share a common value for one or more properties.

A workflow, protocol, plan, algorithm, or computational method specifying how to make an observation, create a sample, or make a change to the state of the world (via an actuator). A procedure is re-usable, and might be involved in many observations, samplings or actuations. It explains the steps to be carried out to arrived at reproducible results.

Device, agent (including humans), or software (simulation) involved in, or implementing, a procedure. Sensors respond to a stimulus, e.e., a change in the environment, or Input data composed from the Results of prior observations, and generate a result. Sensors can be hosted by platforms.
Relation between aÂ SensorÂ and anÂ ObservationÂ made by theÂ Sensor.
System is a unit of abstraction for pieces of infrastructure that implment Procedures. A system may have components,it's subsystems,which are other Systems.
Composition of the name of a Namespace and a LocalName in that Namespace.
TM_Object is a temporal object.
Indication of the quantity of a particular characteristic of an Object.

usage.en: For example, the height of an Object, the weight, the temperature etc. It applies to some property that can be expressed numerically and in a specific unit of measure. Qualitative indications of value like high, low etc. are therefore not included.

description.en: The standardized unit of measure in which the value is expressed.
The unit of measure in which the value is expressed.

usage.en: To be used if no standard unit of measure is known.

description.en: Number by which the quantity of the property can be expressed.
Unit of measure established by a standardizing Organisation.

usage.en: Datatype can be a URI or a TypedString. In the first case, reference is made to units of measure published on the web, preferable those from qudt, eg http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/M for meter. In the case of a TypedString, preference is given to UCUM codes, eg "km/h"^^http://w3id.org/lindt/custom_datatypes#ucumunit.

description.en: The class NamedValue provides for a generic soft-typed parameter value.
Indication of a quantity.

usage.en: Actually the primitive datatypes with which a quantity can be indicated, see xsd datatypes like Float, Double, Decimal, Integer etc.
